questions.question_text: While conducting a follow-up on an asset management audit, the IS auditor finds paid invoices for IT devices not recorded in the organization's inventory. Which of the following is the auditor's BEST course of action?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
When an IS auditor identifies material discrepancies during a follow-up audit—such as paid invoices for devices not recorded in inventory—the auditor must immediately escalate the issue to relevant stakeholders. According to the CISA Review Manual and supporting materials: Auditor Responsibility: The auditor must document findings and present them to management, even if the issue falls outside the initial audit scope. The source material states: "If you identify an issue outside the scope of the audit, don’t disregard it. Document the issue and present it to the client".

Selected Answer: A
As a cyber analyst I can say you never just ask individuals what is happening is where things are. Always assume the worst. In this case I would alert to make it known to many for investigation. I would just just ask the asset management team staff only. I could be wrong but I pick A.

Selected Answer: A
option a
This action is crucial because it addresses a potential issue of asset mismanagement or oversight that could lead to financial discrepancies, compliance issues, or security vulnerabilities. By alerting both audit and operations management, the auditor ensures that the discrepancy is investigated promptly and that corrective actions can be taken to rectify the inventory records.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an analytical review procedure for a payroll system?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Analytical review procedures involve evaluating financial or operational data through logical relationships and consistency checks. The CISA Review Manual explicitly states: "Reasonableness verification of calculated amounts. An application program that verifies the reasonableness of calculated amounts. The reasonableness can be tested to ensure appropriateness to predetermined criteria".

choices.D: Testing hours reported on time sheets
choices.A: Performing reasonableness tests by multiplying the number of employees by the average wage rate
choices.C: Evaluating the performance of the payroll system using benchmarking software
choices.B: Performing penetration attempts on the payroll system
Increase the substantive testing of the financial balances.
choices.D: Place greater reliance on the framework of control.
choices.C: Place greater reliance on the financial application controls.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The CISA manual 28th edition explicitly state the relationship between the strength of internal controls and the extent of substantive testing required . "A direct correlation exists between the level of internal controls and the amount of substantive testing required. If the results of testing controls (compliance tests) reveal the presence of adequate internal controls, then minimizing the substantive procedures could be justified. Conversely, if the control testing reveals weaknesses in controls that may raise doubts about the completeness, accuracy or validity of the accounts, substantive testing can alleviate those doubts."

questions.question_text: During a financial accounting audit, an IS auditor finds that the IT general controls are deficient. Which of the following is the MOST effective course of action to complete the audit?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Disaster recovery recovery time objectives (RTOs) are directly derived from the maximum tolerable downtime (MTD) established during the business impact analysis (BIA). According to the CISA Review Manual and Sybex Study Guide materials:
MTD represents the "maximum period that critical business processes can remain disrupted before the organization faces irreparable harm".
RTO is defined as "the maximum period that elapses from the onset of a disaster until the resumption of service"1. The Sybex Study Guide explicitly states:
"The maximum tolerable downtime (MTD) is established for each critical business process. This drives the development of recovery targets (RTO, RPO)"
